messages.message: <!here> i don’t think map records allows udfs, even though it’s an option in the UI. We get the scripts dir but never do anything with it here: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/shared-utils/py-utils/flow/server/src/py/instabase/flow/runnables/map_record_fns.py#L51
Currently you can only use it for Page Matcher. I believe the docs should be up to date on this one
Our current workaround is to use Apply UDF as our ostensible Map Record step as a custom fn
Oh I see. The docs on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) have a custom formula and instructions on how to register a function
